text:
@geno1082 
Yeah I agree about the tie. Never played much NG2 or DD1 in my childhood, it was mostly Contra, DD2 and Punch-Out, but I still get this awesome nostalgia feeling when listening to these. :P

And yeah sorry, should have specified the "tittle screen" songs. 
Just remebered a nice intro NES song: Wizards and Warriors.
/watch?v=OGWiNiLAy94

It think my vote for #1 would actually go to this one! Too bad it's so short...

text: @pelletier1986 Never mind I saw your comment below and just copy and pasted on the search bar. After listening to all 3, I have to say Double Dragon 1 and Chaosium Sword are tied in the top spot. Both of these games took up a huge chunk of my childhood, which I have no problem with.

text: One thing I don't understand why they have to change the names on the games depending on if you live in Japan, US or Europe. Ninja Gaiden were called "Shadow Warriors" and we never got the 3rd game in trilogy plus the 2nd game is very rare here and hard to find. Shadow of the Ninja was called "Blue Shadow" Strange...
